Job Description
  • The primary function is to conduct research for the development of diagnostics products.
  • The major responsibilities include conducting experiments, summarizing data, presenting data within the team, recommending options for other experiments, and accomplishing established milestones
  • Appropriately documents experimental procedures and results according to established guidelines.
  • Will also participate in troubleshooting instrumentation issues, and experimental anomalies.
  • Will be able to recognize and assist with technical problems.
  • The candidate will participate in planning project tasks and will provide input to accomplish assigned tasks.
  • Will participate in routine maintenance and lab safety.
  • Is responsible for implementing and maintaining the effectiveness of the quality system.
  • Must possess a B.S. or M.S. in life or physical sciences, have basic computer skills, and have knowledge of the regulations and standards affecting IVDs and biologics.
